column2: Definition
Titles, identifying phrases, or names given to an archaeological site.
Index number assigned to archaeological sites
Site numbering scheme used
Term that identifies the named, defined period whose characteristics are represented in the site being cataloged.
The set of shared attitudes, values, goals, and practices that characterizes the site.
The name of the complex of which the work is a part, if applicable.
Geographic area where the site is located
A type of _ationality_field, though not in adjectival form; country refers to the modern name of the country in which the site is located
Concise description of the date or range of dates associated with the creation, construction, or alteration of the site
The time the years of which are numbered before or after the Common Era (CE)
Year that broadly delimits the beginning of an implied date span.
Year that broadly delimits the end of an implied date span.
Dates before which a site could not have functioned
Dates after which a site could not have functioned
Identifiable features that are physically attached in an integral way to the site; natural or created by human activity
Coordinates to establish location
Coordinates using elevation above sea level to establish location
The geographic location and modern name of the site
Location of site documentation and records
Name by which a site/object is traditionally known
The surface features of the site
Man-made alterations of the site
